plugins.name: Preview Card Creator
plugins.description:
Overview

Create a preview card from selected frames. The card contains images generated from the frames and a link back to the original Figma file allowing for easy navigation.


Why use this?

  1. Got summary or overview pages? This is useful for deeper linking into specific pages without having to be familiar with the file.
  2. Got a centralized file that contains the whole application? Stop the file from getting large by replacing full flows with a preview card that deep links to individual Figma files.

plugins.name: DATVM
plugins.description:
DATVM makes it simple to inject realistic and varied data directly into your Figma designs, saving you time and keeping your mockups authentic.


100+ Built-in Datasets

Choose from a wide range of pre-populated categories.


Customizable Lists

Create and manage your own custom lists to perfectly match your project's specific needs.


Sort & Randomize

Sort data alphabetically, by length, or randomize for unique content every time.


Number Formatting

Format numbers with precision. Control decimal places, separators, currency symbols, and percentage variations.


Date Formatting

Easily format dates with customizable separators and order.


Bookmarks

Save your favorite lists for quick and easy access.


How it Works

  1. Select the text layers you want to populate.
  2. Open DATVM.
  3. Choose a data category from the available lists or select a custom list.
  4. Customize formatting options.
  5. Click to populate the selected layers with data.

plugins.name: FlipArabic
plugins.description:
Flip frames, change fonts, and translate copy for Arabic layouts. All with one click.

Let FlipArabic handle localization so you can focus on crafting great experiences.


Made for Your Workflow

  1. Save Time - No hours wasted on manual mirroring or font hunting.
  2. Zero Learning Curve - Select a frame or whole sections for multiple frames and convert!
  3. No Details Lost - Padding, nested auto-layouts, absolute elements, and constraints are all taken care of.
  4. Built-in Translation - AI-powered translation that keeps copy in context (big updates coming in this space).
  5. Smart Font Swapping - Auto-matches weights & styles when exact alternatives aren't available.
  6. Smart Skip for Visuals - Icons, logos, shapes, SVGs & flags keep their original direction.


Fine Tune Your Conversion

  1. Add df or don't flip to layer names to skip flipping
  2. Add dfc or don't flip content to frame names to flip position but keep contents unchanged
  3. Add dt or don't translate to text layer names to keep specific text in English
  4. Add dtc or don't translate content to parent frame names to preserve entire text blocks


For support, ideas or general feedback, reach out to fliparabic@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to Arabic instantly. Flip, change fonts & translate in one click.

135826.name: FlipArabic
135826.description:
Flip frames, change fonts, and translate copy for Arabic layouts. All with one click.

Let FlipArabic handle localization so you can focus on crafting great experiences.


Made for Your Workflow

  1. Save Time - No hours wasted on manual mirroring or font hunting.
  2. Zero Learning Curve - Select a frame or whole sections for multiple frames and convert!
  3. No Details Lost - Padding, nested auto-layouts, absolute elements, and constraints are all taken care of.
  4. Built-in Translation - AI-powered translation that keeps copy in context (big updates coming in this space).
  5. Smart Font Swapping - Auto-matches weights & styles when exact alternatives aren't available.
  6. Smart Skip for Visuals - Icons, logos, shapes, SVGs & flags keep their original direction.


Fine Tune Your Conversion

  1. Add df or don't flip to layer names to skip flipping
  2. Add dfc or don't flip content to frame names to flip position but keep contents unchanged
  3. Add dt or don't translate to text layer names to keep specific text in English
  4. Add dtc or don't translate content to parent frame names to preserve entire text blocks


For support, ideas or general feedback, reach out to fliparabic@gmail.com

networkAccess.reasoning: Access to the translation proxy server for translations

135826.release_notes:
- Smarter layer detection for skips - only skips elements when the entire name contains skip words (no more accidentally skipping "Logo Colored" or "Icon/Text")
- Better handling of grid layouts with wrapping
- Fixed stacking order issues in overlapping elements
- Increased capacity to handle up to 3,000 elements
- Faster, clearer progress notifications
- Components with "df" keyword will not be detached
135826.tagline: Convert your designs to Arabic instantly. Flip, change fonts & translate in one click.

plugins.description:
ðŸ” Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default â€œ_â€) and choose the search scopeâ€”current page or whole file.


Features

â€¢Any nesting depth â€“ detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

â€¢Page-level grouping â€“ shows how many problematic components each page contains.

â€¢One-click jump â€“ selects and zooms to the target instance.

â€¢Custom prefix â€“ works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

â€¢Before publishing a library â€“ make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

â€¢During a design-system migration â€“ quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

â€¢While reviewing external files â€“ instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled â€œOutside pagesâ€ exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figmaâ€”no internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.

## æ³¨æ„äº‹é …

- ç”Ÿæˆã•ã‚Œã‚‹altãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã¯AIã«ã‚ˆã‚‹è‡ªå‹•ç”Ÿæˆã®ãŸã‚ã€æœ€çµ‚çš„ãªå†…å®¹ã¯ã”è‡ªèº«ã§ã”ç¢ºèªãã ã•ã„ã€‚


---


## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1â€“5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "ã€" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "æ—¥æœ¬èªž | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1â€“5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "ã€" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "æ—¥æœ¬èªž | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

plugins.name: Add Section
plugins.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections

plugins.name: Quick Navigator
plugins.description:
Quick Navigator is a lightweight yet powerful plugin designed to help you stay oriented while working on large or complex Figma files. Instead of endlessly zooming and panning around, this plugin gives you a miniature view of your entire canvas thus making it easier than ever to find what you're looking for.


Features:

  1. See all your frames and sections in a simplified, scrollable mini window.
  2. Tap on any visible frame or section in the mini view to instantly select and focus it on the main canvas.
  3. Ideal when you're moving fast, experimenting, or managing chaotic canvases, no need for everything to be clean or structured.


NOTE: Currently, SVG shapes and text layers are not included in the mini view.
plugins.tagline: Never get lost on the canvas again!

LocalizeBuddy automatically extracts every text layer from your Figma file and converts it into clean, structured JSONâ€”perfectly formatted for any localization pipeline. Skip the tedious copy-and-paste: design and ship faster with truly seamless internationalization. âœ¨


Standout Features:


ðŸ” Comprehensive Text Discovery

Auto-detects every text node, even deep inside groups, components, and nested frames.


ðŸ”‘ Smart Key Mapping

Auto-generate consistent, position-based keys that mirror your design hierarchyâ€”e.g. page1.frame2.text3â€”so every JSON entry is predictably unique without relying on layer-name transformations.


ðŸ“‚ Structured JSON Output

Preserve your art-board and frame hierarchy in the output to keep context clear for translators.


ðŸ–¼ï¸ Frame-Only Export

Export the selected frame in one clickâ€”ideal for precise, frame-level JSON extraction.
